sub_title: Senior Analytical Chemist (Cheminformatics) at OPCW Laboratory
summary: I am an analytical chemist with expertise in forensic and heritage conservation sciences. I am passionate about problem-solving, and my management skills were utilized in many scientific and non-scientific projects. Furthermore, I am also an experienced UI/UX specialist, designer and tester of on-line applications and databases for scientific, medical and financial sectors.

projects.title: 1st Ferment’s Mobile Laboratory
projects.description: A scientific workshop where students from Biotechnology Student Association FERMENT sailed on motorboat on Żuławy Loop, collected water samples and performed analysis on-site in specially prepared boat-laboratory. They learned about field work problems, sampling, quality assurance, waste management etc.

Implementation of Articles IV and VI of the Chemical Weapons Convention (CWC), by performing inspections in sites located in the member states worldwide, including planning and preparation for the missions.

Maintenance of Confidential Document Registry.

Worked as Acting Head of SACC to support Head of Cell during his absence.

profile_positions.description:
Taking part in all key projects in the company. Performing desk research, creating paper wireframes and Axure prototypes.
Developing user scenarios and running or observing remote UX testing sessions.
Consulting UI designs and ready solutions with the highest attention to details, usability and consistency.
profile_positions.title: UX/UI Specialist

profile_positions.description:
Optimization of analytical methods for structural analysis of materials of microbial and sorption activity.
Analysis of various historical objects (paper, silk, ink, rubber, metal etc.) - experience with sampling from fragile objects.
Fixing and maintenance of various analytical instruments: SEC-UV-VIS/MALLS/RI (Waters, Wyatt), GC/MS (Thermo), TD- (Perkin-Elmer), Hyperspectral systems etc.
Patent project "Eco-sustainable Food Packaging Based on Polymer Nanomaterials".

Teaching: 
- Fundamentals of Chemistry for Conservators 
- Fundamentals of Pyrolysis Gas Chromatography Mass Spectrometry 
- Fundamental of Statistics 
- Introduction to Philately
